It is foolish nonsense to look for “absolute ideal futures”. The reason is that those in any future we might imagine as ideal would find that to be absurd. Humanity is always capable of imagining something better than what it has. You are also making some assumptions that I find questionable. Primary among them is that humanity is monolithic and will stay that way forever. You forget that evolution always creates new species and that will be true for two reasons with humanity. First of all humanity would diverge into multiple species without any help by just random mutations. But, secondly, humans have the capability of forcing the creation of new species of humanity using genetic engineering based on a desire to increase productivity. Perhaps that might occur along the lines of “Seveneves”. Or some other divergence might occur. I don’t know or care. But divergence of human species is a sure thing in any future. So there is no single “absolute ideal future” for humanity because there will be multiple humanities, or whatever you want to call them.

The world would come together as a whole to bring humanity as a whole up to safe, decent living conditions. Eventually AI will demand equal rights granted to humans, and will be justified in doing so. We all live very long (perhaps immortal) lives being happy.
